question: ______  cut the stems into strips, pressed them, and dried them into sheets that could be rolled into scrolls.
As in many ancient societies, much of the knowledge of  ______  came about as priests studied the world to find ways to please the gods.
About 5,000 years ago, they noticed that a star now called Sirius appeared shortly before the  ______  began to flood.
The  ______  meant “great house,” and it was originally used to describe the king’s palace.
About 80 years later, a  ______  named Khufu decided he wanted a monument that would show the world how great he was.
About 80  ______  later, a pharaoh named Khufu decided he wanted a monument that would show the world how great he was.
The word pharaoh meant “great house,” and it was originally used to describe the  ______ ’s palace.
Mourners filled the  ______  with objects ranging from food to furniture that the mummified pharaoh would need.
Before entering a temple, a  ______  bathed and put on special linen garments and white sandals.
Cities emerge as centers of culture and power, and  ______  learn to do jobs that do not involve agriculture.
A city called Giza was built for the  ______  workers and the people who fed, clothed, and housed them.
______ , Black Land The ancient Egyptians lived in narrow bands of land on each side of the Nile.
As in many ancient societies, much of the knowledge of Egypt came about as priests studied the world to find ways to please the  ______ .
Unlike the Tigris and Euphrates, the  ______  flooded at the same time every year, so farmers could predict when to plant their crops.
These beautiful blue  ______  were used in jewelry.The Nile had fish and other wildlife that Egyptians wanted.
